From: Cisco IOS Configuration Fundamentals Command Reference
FuncDef: To configure a temporary password on a line, use the **lock** command in EXEC mode.

ParaDef.Info: This commmand has no arguments or keywords.

Examples: The following example shows configuring the router as lockable, saving the configuration, and then locking the current session for the user:
ExtraInfo: You can prevent access to your session while keeping your connection open by setting up a temporary password. To lock access to the terminal, perform the following steps:---**Step 1** ![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)Enter the **lock** command. The system prompts you for a password.**Step 2** ![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)Enter a password, which can be any arbitrary string. The system will prompt you to confirm the password. The screen then clears and displays the message "Locked."**Step 3** ![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)To regain access to your sessions, reenter the password.---The Cisco IOS software honors session timeouts on a locked lines. You must clear the line to remove this feature. The system administrator must set the line up to allow use of the temporary locking feature by using the **lockable** line configuration command.

RelatedCmds.description: Enables or changes a login username.
